description: From Latin licitus (“lawful”), perfect participle of licet (“[it] is permitted”, impersonal verb).

adjectives.description: licit (comparative more licit, superlative most licit)

entries.meaning: Not forbidden by formal or informal rules.
examples: Let it not be in any way licit to anyone among men to infringe this page of our confirmation, or to contravene it with rash daring.

entries.meaning: (law) Explicitly established or constituted by law.
